website_summaries.verdict: An all-time classic with a simple but highly entertaining design that somehow never gets old. Whether you choose it for the price or because of nostalgia, this push and pull toy is bound be a hit.
pros: Uncomplicated design encourages imaginative play and can easily become a vacuum cleaner or a lawn mower in the right hands
Colorful popping balls delight most kids and keeps them coming back for more
cons: Popping mechanism works best on carpet
Noise delights kids, but may drive some parents crazy

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the $
customer_reviews.text: This product sucks.... I bought it because I wanted my son to enjoy something as I did as a child however the handle broke right off when he was pushing it so i had my father look at it to see if he could fix it and he found that it was not properly put together in the first place and its not fixable.... I am so mad about this product because I figured for the price i paid it would have been a great product but its definitely not plus its small
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy Clarkson

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for a new walker
customer_reviews.text: My one-year-old grandson's current mission in life (he started walking a couple of months ago), is to push things through the house. This popper toy is just the ticket! From the moment he laid eyes on it, it has been his "go-to" toy. It keeps him busy off-and-on for hours during the day. It's fun to watch his intensity as he examines the wheels and the popping balls while pushing it through the house. The popper is colorful and joyfully noisy, but it's also durable, so when he drives it into cabinets, furniture or the wall, it stands up to the beating but also does no damage. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: MaMaWoman

customer_reviews.title: A great classic toy
customer_reviews.text: My daughter had one when she was little in the 80s and now my one-year-old granddaughter has one. It's still the great little item it always was. The only thing I would change is that the item used to be able to stand upright by placing it on its nose, but this one has to be either leaned against the wall or just lay flat. Still a great push toy, and she loves pretending to vacuum with her mom!
customer_reviews.author: A66eyroad

customer_reviews.title: The wheels are too slick and simply do not turn ...
customer_reviews.text: The wheels are too slick and simply do not turn on any kind of smooth surface such as hardwood, laminate, or tile.
customer_reviews.author: BG

customer_reviews.title: Toddler still holds interest!
customer_reviews.text: I got this because my son loves lawn mowers and vacuum cleaners. The model ones are usually expensive. This one makes up for it. He loves moving them around the house. Unlike the other reviews, mine works perfect. They pop when pushed forward and pulled backward. He is two and took a liking to it instantly. I wish I had got this for him earlier. A must have toy for kids who love to push things around!
customer_reviews.author: Vinodh

customer_reviews.title: My Siblings Love Me for this Giving this Gift
customer_reviews.text: First off, we have no kids but that has not stopped me from buying one of these for each child born in our extended families. More annoying than giving them a drum. More colorful than giving the little tykes several cans of spray paint. More fun also awaits when the parent tries to hide it. And the price is amazing and delivery is swift. Thank you Fisher Price Popcorn Popper!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Nostalgic Toy
customer_reviews.text: This is a toy that’s been around for a long time. An old favorite for little ones. My two year old grandson’s love it. There was one tiny problem. One of the balls still had a loose piece of plastic on it. It still works great. The tots don’t seem to notice, just me. It’s probably a fluke.
customer_reviews.author: Lydia Quinn

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t always pop
customer_reviews.text: I remembered having one of these as a child and it was inexpensive as an add on item which I why I bought it. It is what it is for a $6 toy but it doesn’t pop when pushing it forward (as most kids would). It only seems to pop when going in a backwards direction. This just seems backwards to me and I feel the product should instead pop when pushing in any direction
customer_reviews.author: Lea B

customer_reviews.title: Great gift with hours of playtime!
customer_reviews.text: She adored her birthday gift. Played with this most of the day. Doesn’t make a ton of noise, but enough to grab the child’s attention and keep them busy. Does require some assembly with a quick screwdriver.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Jean Massie

customer_reviews.title: Noisy
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my grandchild as a joke. My son had one as a child and it was a never-ending noise maker. He loved it and would walk about our house constantly making it "pop." I told him before he got married (and in jest) that one day I'd get even with him and but one for children. Well, some 26 years later it was delivered to his daughter and as they say, "revenge is best served...!" All in good fun as it's an excellent toy, but noisy at 4:00 a.m.!
customer_reviews.author: RR

customer_reviews.title: Not loud enough!
customer_reviews.text: Funny how I remember seeing these at our friend's home when we didn't have kids and the popping noise was annoying as their kid played with it. Now that I bought this for our 1 year old, I wish it was loud enough so that it would keep him more interested. The popping noise is almost non-existent. So, I'm guessing Fisher-Price heard complaints from non-parents about how noisy they are and decided to change this, but honestly, the kids prefer the noisiness.
customer_reviews.author: Noodle Poodle

customer_reviews.title: Missing major piece
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a first birthday present for my niece, but when we opened the packaging it was in we were missing the lower half of the handle that has the dots on it. There was no way to attach just the top half of the handle and without that piece it was far too short even for a one year old. Very disappointed we had to take it away from her to get a new one shipped.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

customer_reviews.title: Classic toddler toy
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these as a kid. It's great to be able to get one for my grandson. He loves pushing it around. The popping sound seems quieter than what I remember, which is actually very nice. Then again, maybe it's just my hearing degrading!
customer_reviews.author: Rogue

customer_reviews.title: meets every Glamma & Poppa requirement to highest standard in EVERYWAY
customer_reviews.text: Grandson (see video)knowing now to open gifts on his own (1st Xmas 1yr old ) He opened other gifts but insisted on going bck 2 play w/popper His fav toy for hrs back n forth all over entire house Let’s parents handle they chores and know he’s ok cuz they hear the popper Lol & MOMMY & daddy unable to take Batteries out this toy to make sssh^^^^ cuz there is none
customer_reviews.author: SavageLife

customer_reviews.title: 13 month old son LOVES it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 13 month old son, he absolutely loves it. Super easy to assemble. Only required three screws (which are included). I was very pleased to find out that they popcorn doesn’t pop as loud as it used to ten years ago lol He absolutely loves pushing and dragging this thing all over the house. Best toy, most use, definitely would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Momofboys

customer_reviews.title: Love this toy
customer_reviews.text: The reason why I give it 4 stars is because it’s not as loud of a pop as I remember these toys were years and years ago. Although the toy is very sturdy and easy to use and assemble, the pop isn’t as loud as I thought. Which is a bummer because I like it. Other than that, toy is just as described. Cute toy.
customer_reviews.author: jr509

customer_reviews.title: Children love this...parents, not so much. ;-)
customer_reviews.text: Classic child’s toy that children love and parents hate due to the noise it makes! My family had one when I was growing up, my children had one, and this one was purchased for a granddaughter who is turning one. (Her parents may live to regret placing this item on their child’s wishlist! LOL!)
customer_reviews.author: Phoenix K

customer_reviews.title: My two year olds favorite toy, and extremely durable!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing, yet so very simple and classic. I got this thing for $5 for my daughter, and it’s one of her favorite toys, even above her more expensive ones. It’s been thrown down stairs, run around the house and been beaten with other toys, and has no signs of wear. Truely made for toddlers!
customer_reviews.author: Britt

customer_reviews.title: She likes it!
customer_reviews.text: It took a couple months for my 18 month old to take an interest in this push toy but she now plays with it often. The only downfall to this toy is that your toddler’s hands/arms have to be low since raising their arms too high stops the toy from moving forward.
customer_reviews.author: Ira

customer_reviews.title: Quieter than original popper. Must also assemble.
customer_reviews.text: The reason I gave it a 3 star review is because this isn’t like the original popper. First I had to assemble the toy it came in three pieces. It was very easy to assemble. The original came in one piece. The other is the level of noise is quieter than the original. The reason I like the louder version was because I can hear my child play. I guess fisher price must have had complaints of the noise level of the original popper to change it. Other than that the toy is still good.
customer_reviews.author: HBA

customer_reviews.title: Good remake of a classic toy!
customer_reviews.text: Fisher price did a really good job of recreating a classic toy for a new generation. This one is made of plastic, has rounded, softer edges and still pops like the old one. It will be interesting to see how durable it is, since it's used weekly in preschool classes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A simple but magic toy
customer_reviews.text: My husband blamed me for buying such a 'boring' toy for my two year old. But very soon he apologized to me when he saw how my LO loves to push this toy all around the house. Yes, it's quite simple, but there is something magic about this little toy that all toddlers I see definitely love them.
customer_reviews.author: JZ

customer_reviews.title: Great Classic toy 😁great buy.
customer_reviews.text: My grandson adores this toy is his ultimate favorite popper. My first grand daughter is 18 she had one of these poppers, and now my 18 years later, another grandchild has one, and he loves it.... Classic toy
customer_reviews.author: annamarie nelson

customer_reviews.title: “Way ‘ta go grandpa”
customer_reviews.text: I gave it all high ratings but to be forthright you really should ask my daughter and her husband. It was a gift to my grandson. I would imagine one of the first things they would tell you is....it’s obnoxiously loud 🤣 “Wait a second”. “I think they left it here”!
customer_reviews.author: Tim B.

customer_reviews.title: blast from the past...
customer_reviews.text: I remember this toy as a child & got it for my children. Got this for my youngest granddaughter and she loves pulling it around. My only complaint is that it only pops when its going backwards, but she doesn't seem to notice much since she pulls it around
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I expected!
customer_reviews.text: There were so many of these listed, on various sites, for differing prices, that I was confused about exactly what I was getting. I'm very happy with this toy. My son purchased one at a retail store and is disappointed in how loud his is. The one we purchased is NOT loud -- it's perfect. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Becky H.

customer_reviews.title: Every Baby Should Have One
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my granddaughter's birthday. It's the same as the one both of my daughters played with as toddlers. It brought back so many memories and it is very reasonable priced.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Pops on pull, not push
customer_reviews.text: My one year old loves this. But it only pops when he pulls it, not when he pushes it, which is kind of sad because he can't see it in action.
customer_reviews.author: LC

customer_reviews.title: Has to be assembled.
customer_reviews.text: I buy about three a year, in one piece, for my English bulldog to push around like a kid would. These three poppers I ordered, had to be assembled. Not sure if they will be as durable.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: A timeless classic
customer_reviews.text: I have bought several of these over the years and while they have changed from wood to plastic, they all work well at making noise and delighting the toddlers. This is a must have toy-especially if you do not live in the house and have to listen to it all day long.
customer_reviews.author: Recorder

customer_reviews.title: Once they can walk, get them a “Popper” ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
customer_reviews.text: This is a great push toy. A real classic that’s entertained little kids for decades. I think it’s a great buy on Amazon for $10. Once they start walking, buy them a Popper
customer_reviews.author: David S.

customer_reviews.title: Hardly makes noise.  Not quality
customer_reviews.text: 3rd toy bought from amazon as a gift and it came in a brown box. Will no longer buy toys for gifts from amazon. Popper makes little noise. Not the quality toy of years past
customer_reviews.author: Jo W

customer_reviews.title: Better than the noisy old fashioned ones
customer_reviews.text: Every kid should have one! These are so much quieter than the old-time ones by Fisher-Price. Still noisy enough for kids to enjoy but doesn’t drive the parents nuts ;)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Find a vintage bone this one does not compare
customer_reviews.text: Procdut is nice to look at and looks sturdy. But the balls inside are a blown up light plastic and do not make the popping sound right. This is nothing like the classic one.
customer_reviews.author: d dooly

customer_reviews.title: Keeps toddlers active and occupied
customer_reviews.text: My toddlers were constantly fighting over this toy, so i had to buy another! They call it their "choo choo" and love running around the house with them.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Fun Toy, not as much fun as the vintage one.
customer_reviews.text: Cons -Not as cool as the old school Popper. It is smaller, lighter and less sturdy. It also has a muted sound. It’s not the popper you remembered. Pros- less likely to cause injury or headaches. Goes together easily and my grandchildren love it.
customer_reviews.author: City Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Entertainment for hours
customer_reviews.text: This item is a headache for most moms, so keep that in mind. HOWEVER, the noise never bothers me and I love seeing the enjoyment in my sons eyes as he plays with it. And you can not beat that price!
customer_reviews.author: Mal Trefts

customer_reviews.title: New look to an old standard
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! Children love these and unless you have a destructive big dog I can’t imagine it being broken. Great price and quick delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Foralark

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Was disappointed. Bought this for ou grandson’s 1st birthday and it was whimpy compared the ones we had gotten Ed his cousins. It hardly popped and was lighter weight.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my children for Christmas just cause I remember them as a kid. Made great well worth the price. N they absolutely love em.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Strausbaugh

customer_reviews.title: Good toy for busy new walkers
customer_reviews.text: I loved the simplicity of this toy that created tons of fun for my new little walker. I do wish that it had a way to stand up when it wasn’t in use though.
customer_reviews.author: BFish

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't pop going forward - only pops when going backward!
customer_reviews.text: Was excited to give this to my toddler when she was finally able to walk well enough to use it, but ended up disappointed because it doesn't pop when she is pushing it forward! It only pops when it's rolling backward. Seems like a mechanism somewhere is messed up. =/
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it
customer_reviews.text: My kids run around with this daily and it holds up well. Be sure when youre putting it together that you slide the handle ALL the way down into the slot because it screws down and if its not all the way down the handle will pop out
customer_reviews.author: KatesPrime1

customer_reviews.title: Item defective
customer_reviews.text: The item arrived damaged and defective. The wheels do not work, therefore the balls will not “pop.” There are also stuff marks on the toy and it looks damaged, or like it had been used and returned previously. I will be returning the item.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey Masters

customer_reviews.title: They love it. They run and walk with them and ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of them for my twins. They love it. They run and walk with them and even ride the stroller while “driving” these toys in front of them)))) thanks to the noise that they make it’s easier to keep an eye on them
customer_reviews.author: Fatima

customer_reviews.title: Perfection
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 11 month old for Christmas and she adores it! Better price than the big box stores and arrived promptly and in damaged
customer_reviews.author: Shanna

customer_reviews.title: Not as energetic as ones of my childhood
customer_reviews.text: Does NOT pop as well as I remember it popping / wheels have a tendency to slide o hard wood floors vs roll. Not very loud either
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie L. Mangold

customer_reviews.title: Super fun classic toy
customer_reviews.text: A classic. My 1 year old loves it. Easy to put together so easy my 11 year old did it. It’s a great simple toy at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Keykee

customer_reviews.title: It is indeed what it is.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my 18 month old granddaughter. She seemed to like it, but I can't tell you if she continued to like it. Her parents hid it when they got sick of hearing it pop, pop, pop.... ingrates.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas O.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: There are not enough balls in the popper to even make a noise. My grand daughter does not find it an exciting toy. Definitely not like they used to be years ago
customer_reviews.author: Karen Scarbrough

customer_reviews.title: Daughter loves it! Works and pops as it should!
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old daughter loves the pink corn popper we bought her. Don't make your decision on all the negative reviews, I'm sure some people got defective poppers, but mine rolls and pops perfectly. Now maybe there could be a little more balls, but it's wouldn't make that much of a difference. Everything my daughter does is precious in my eyes, so the popping doesn't bother me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in the quality of this toy. Doesn’t say much for fisher price. Balls barely pop and makes no noise and the wheels squeak intolerably.
customer_reviews.author: A. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: SAFE WELL MADE
customer_reviews.text: Great Toy! Still Same Quality Made As It Was Over Many... Years When I Purchased Them For My Children.
customer_reviews.author: Renee Saint-James

customer_reviews.title: My son loves it
customer_reviews.text: My son loves it and plays with in almost every day. For the price, we all had one as a kid, you can't beat it!
customer_reviews.author: Nick Evanish

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work on tile floors
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son because it is one of those toys that everyone remembers having when they were a kid. Too bad the quality is so bad now. Our home has all tile floors and the wheels will not turn in order for the popping action to work.
customer_reviews.author: Karen B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to irritate the Daughter - highly successful. This is a classic toy and the kids love them
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Smith

customer_reviews.title: Delivered late. And broken
customer_reviews.text: Another piece of garbage from amazon. I wish I read the reviews before hand. Doesn’t work . Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.author: Janet d

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Not walking yet, but likes pulling it back and forth. I am sure when she gets started she will enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: marie b.

customer_reviews.title: Handle design change makes is worse
customer_reviews.text: The new handle design is terrible, why change the good old design just for the sake of it.
customer_reviews.author: The JAKAL

customer_reviews.title: The grand kid loves it!
customer_reviews.text: This is great fun. It's just like the one you used to have as a kid, only now it's made out of plastic and not wood, as you would expect. It rolls easily and makes lots of noise. The grand kid loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Dimbly

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful toy for little ones
customer_reviews.text: A great toy! It has lasted the test if time My son loved it 35 years ago and his son lives it today!
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Pineau

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for little ones!
customer_reviews.text: I love this classic toy! It took our 1 year old daughter a little bit to figure it out, but once she did, she plays with it all the time and carries it all over the house with her! Definitely accomplished the goal of teaching the pushing and pulling concept, as she uses it both ways.
customer_reviews.author: M&B17

customer_reviews.title: Not quite like the original but still good fun!
customer_reviews.text: Not as loud as the popper I had as a kid but still lots of fun and can take the kind of beating two year olds dish out.
customer_reviews.author: Anni

customer_reviews.title: Classic
customer_reviews.text: The originals should be left alone and just keep making them. They were awesome toys. I am tired of toys being made for midgets. They are already small.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Quality toy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as it was just like one I had as a small child 35 years ago. I was hoping that the quality would be just as good and this one did not disappoint. It came fully assembled and feels to be of good quality. It has made it through some rough play and still works as new. It easily pops going forwards and backwards and is easy for a one year old to maneuver.
customer_reviews.author: CTB

customer_reviews.title: Great priced toy.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for babies that have just learned to walk recently. It can be a little loud but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Kia O'Hara

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a birthday gift for my 1yo it reminds me of the one I had back in the day so I loved it no complaints here
customer_reviews.author: Montavia J

customer_reviews.title: Gift
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a Christmas present baby hasn’t gotten to use it yet but it went together easy and seemed sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea Abraham

customer_reviews.title: Still Great
customer_reviews.text: Had one for each generation of new walkers. Still the same great loud sound while infant is learning to walk...
customer_reviews.author: julie robinson

customer_reviews.title: Fun for the little one!
customer_reviews.text: My little guy loves it. Pushing it back and forth and seeing the balls pop around keeps him so entertained.
customer_reviews.author: Kat S

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: This isn’t as loud as they use to be. It’s quieter. I was a little disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Miah

customer_reviews.title: A memorable Toy !
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as part of a baby shower gifts I sent to an out of town shower I could not attend . Apparently it was the hit of the gifts as all the Mom’s lovingly remembered having one . They “tested “ it for fun and it worked great
customer_reviews.author: Southerngrandmother

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, but a favorite gift!
customer_reviews.text: I was just looking for something small as a Christmas gift when I found this. It reminded me of my younger days, and I'm glad I got it! My grandson wouldn't let go of it for hours when he got it.
customer_reviews.author: Craven

customer_reviews.title: Pop pop pop! Kids love it
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my granddaughter simply bc her mom(my daughter) had one when she was little and it drove us nuts ha! Returning the favor! It’s a cute and fun toy for the little ones.
customer_reviews.author: kat

customer_reviews.title: Better for 2 and up
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a 1 1/2 year old who loves to push things around. The problem is the balls don't pop when she pushes it. I guess she doesn't push down hard enough. The popping noise is the enticement of this toy, so, blah.....
customer_reviews.author: Sharon W.

customer_reviews.title: Worth it !
customer_reviews.text: So cute and very sturdy my son is 1 and slams this every where and it’s still in one piece.
customer_reviews.author: Dontae

customer_reviews.title: The product works as it should
customer_reviews.text: Bought this items without reading the reviews because I really wanted my son to have such a classic toy. When I did read the reviews however I was a bit worried because alot of the reviews said that the wheels do not turn in the newer version. The wheels spins fine on titled floor. The items works as it is supposed to. My 18 month old son however is not interested in it. But my 2 year old niece loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Leann George

customer_reviews.title: Toy corn popper
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loves his new corn popper. A timeless toy that never gets old for a small child. I loved mine when I was a little kid.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy J.

customer_reviews.title: DEJA-VU
customer_reviews.text: My husband had to have this for our most recent grandchild. He had one as a child and now he is reliving his childhood. He runs it for awhile and granddaughter follows & giggles...then she runs it and grandpa follows & giggles
customer_reviews.author: DEBRA BRYANT

customer_reviews.title: love
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly and I love watching my daughter run around the house with it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Developmental Toy!!!
customer_reviews.text: Every child should have one of these will buy again for other little ones in my life!
customer_reviews.author: V

customer_reviews.title: Toy Corn Popper
customer_reviews.text: Like all Fisher-Price toys...safe and sturdy, long lasting. Granddaughter loved it! :) Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Rebel Lady

customer_reviews.title: Did not realize I had to put it together I guess I did not read that in the post
customer_reviews.text: Did not realize I had to put it together but I'm letting my husband do that
customer_reviews.author: Family of 6

customer_reviews.title: Popper
customer_reviews.text: Love this for walking toddlers they love how much sound it makes
customer_reviews.author: Harthun

customer_reviews.title: Junk.  Not as good as older models.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement for another popper our child received as a gift. The gifted popper did not pop when pushed forward. The newer popper is made much cheaper. Balls are hollow plastic instead of heavier solid plastic. The dome is not clear like the older model. The “popping action” is not as strong either. Should have read the reviews. Highly disappointed. Will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work well
customer_reviews.text: In days gone by the balls popped quickly, this one doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: Pam P

customer_reviews.title: What I said above.
customer_reviews.text: Grandbaby loves it and it's quieter than the original were.
customer_reviews.author: Clare

customer_reviews.title: Fisher-Price Corn Popper
customer_reviews.text: I bought this corn popper for my god-son for Christmas. He enjoyed it very much. He played with it for hours.
customer_reviews.author: Donna P. Howard

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: The gift I always give on 1st birthdays! No negative issues.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Only pops when pull back
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great and classic toy but only pops when pulling back. It does not pop when you push forward.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Wow! Change is good!
customer_reviews.text: Much quieter than the corn popper they had when I was younger. No loud obnoxious popping sound.
customer_reviews.author: C. Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: FUN FUN FUN POP POP POP
customer_reviews.text: My 19-months-old granddaughter LOVES this thing. She pushes it all around the house saying, “pop, pop, POP” over and over.
customer_reviews.author: mca12351

customer_reviews.title: The flavor
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble as long as you have a screw driver
customer_reviews.author: A  happy shopper

customer_reviews.title: Bummer
customer_reviews.text: The balls don’t pop quite as loud as I was expecting. Bought for my nephew to annoy my sister and was disappointed in how not annoying it was.
customer_reviews.author: Thatgunguy

customer_reviews.title: Dirty product
customer_reviews.text: Package was unsealed and product was dirty when it arrived. Had to wash it. Still has stains in backside.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Joye Middleton

customer_reviews.title: A great classic. Love that it's not pink or blue.
customer_reviews.text: A classic. My daughter loves it and I'm glad it's not pink. Sick of toys only having a blue or pink option.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia S

customer_reviews.title: Awesome value!
customer_reviews.text: Helped me save money during my holiday gift-giving. Thank you!

customer_reviews.text: it works but is not as big as the old ones

customer_reviews.title: Great gift, your child will be entertained
customer_reviews.text: Love it. My sister had one 20+ years ago and I had to buy one for my daughter. It doesn't feel as sturdy as the vintage one and it also doesn't pop as loud. The softer popping can be a good thing I guess. Though my sister & I, as kids, enjoyed the loud pop and it was always easy to find my sister with the noise.
customer_reviews.author: judeam

customer_reviews.title: POP POP POP, my daughter hates it, grand daughter loves it.
customer_reviews.text: Headline says it all! Noisemaker deluxe would be a better name.
customer_reviews.author: Dude

product_meta.title: Fisher-Price Corn Popper [Amazon Exclusive]
product_meta.description: Style:Blue (Closed Box)Get ready for ball-popping fun, baby! As your baby pushes the Corn Popper toy along, the brightly colored balls excitedly pop around, encouraging your little cruiser to keep going. And the faster your baby goes, the faster the poppity-pop action! Where development comes into play; Gross Motor: Little muscles get a big workout as your baby pushes the Corn Popper toy along. Sensory: Bright colors and exciting popping sounds stimulate your baby's developing auditory and visual senses. Curiosity & Wonder: Little ones are introduced to cause & effect as they discover how to make the balls pop around by pushing the toy along.
feature_bullets: Push along for exciting ball-popping sounds & action
Encourages baby to walk with fun popping sounds & action
Little muscles get a big workout as your baby pushes the Corn Popper toy along
Bright colors and exciting popping sounds stimulate your baby's developing auditory and visual senses
Little ones are introduced to cause & effect as they discover how to make the balls pop around by pushing the toy along
